title: Drawing, "Design for a clock", 1800–25
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and yellow, red watercolor, graphite, on cream laid paper
markings: Fortuna over CV, (partial watermark); at lower right: Cooper Union stamp #457D
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink, lower center: Paphos/18/060 [---] alid/nuod env/Enif
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: Base of clock supported by tapered feet, front panel decorated with crossed horns and wreath, trophies at either side. A lyre stands on top of dial. At right, a young woman in classical garb holds a roll of paper in her left hand. A tall-handled pitcher is at left of dial.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a clock", 1800–25.
1800–25. Pen and black ink, brush and yellow, red watercolor, graphite, on cream laid paper. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1931-71-6.
